Is the list [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2; v_3\}[/mathjaxinline] linearly dependent or linearly independent?

font.p: We notice that [mathjaxinline]-3v_1 = v_3[/mathjaxinline], so that [mathjaxinline]3 v_1 + 0 v_2 + 1 v_3 = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline]. Therefore, [mathjaxinline]a_1 = 3[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]a_2 = 0[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]a_3 = 1[/mathjaxinline] is a possible set of scalars that satisfies the equation. (Any scalar multiple of that triple is also a set that satisfies the equation.)

The list [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2; v_3\}[/mathjaxinline] is linearly dependent because, as we've just seen, there exist sets of coefficients, not all zero, that yield [mathjaxinline]a_1v_1 + a_2 v_2 + a_3 v_3 = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline].
